Authors:
Carlos Alberto Salvador-Montoya, Orlando F. Popoff, Mateus
Arduvino Reck, Elisandro Ricardo Drechsler-Santos
Title:
Taxonomic delimitation of Fulvifomes robiniae
(Hymenochaetales, Basidiomycota) and related species in America: F.
squamosus sp. nov.
Keywords:
Hymenochaetaceae, taxonomy, polypore, host distribution,
geographic distribution.
Abstract:
Morphological revision of Fulvifomes robiniae, as well as
phylogenetic inferences based on nITS and nLSU markers, indicated that
the species has a narrower concept in its morphology and distribution.
Other morphologically related taxa arise from this taxonomic approach.
Fulvifomes cedrelae is not accepted as a synonym of F. robiniae and
Fulvifomes squamosus sp. nov. is described as new based on Peruvian
specimens. Based on morphology, phylogenetic relationships and host
distributions, the taxonomic implication for the genus and other related
taxa are discussed.
